title: Anita Sheoran Challenges the Status Quo: CWG Gold Medalist Contests for WFI Presidency Amidst Sexual Harassment Scandal
content:
Anita Sheoran, a 2010 Commonwealth Games gold medalist and a key witness in the sexual harassment case against former Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, has entered the race for the federation's presidency. 

Sheoran's candidacy, the only female contender, is seen as a significant step towards change within the male-dominated world of Indian wrestling.  She is supported by the protesting wrestlers, who have been vocal in demanding accountability and reform within the federation.

However, Sheoran faces a tough battle against candidates linked to the previous administration.  The upcoming elections will be a crucial test of whether the wrestling community is ready for change and a more inclusive future.
author: Scroll Staff
